New Records: Freddie Freeman set the Series RBI record with 12 RBIs and was named MVP; Shohei Ohtani, despite injury, celebrated in the locker room after the win
Key Match Events: The Dodgers overcame a five-run deficit in the fifth inning due to Yankees' errors; Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to help secure the win
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were known for their resilience and focus throughout the season; the Yankees started strong with early home runs but struggled to maintain the lead
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed heartbreak over the loss; Dave Roberts highlighted the team's ability to overcome adversity and win the championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans celebrated in Los Angeles following the win; the game was marked by a unique set of circumstances including post-game incidents
Others: The Dodgers' victory marked their eighth World Series title and their first since 1988 in a non-shortened season; the Yankees' loss ended their 15-year championship drought
